item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
item.description: "Well-behaved women seldom make history." -- Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Tom Angleberger
item.description: "Didn't Gandalf say "With great power comes great responsibility"? (If it wasn't Gandalf, maybe it was Thomas Jefferson. Or Spider-Man's uncle.)" -- Tom Angleberger

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by St. Francis Of Assisi
item.description: "All the darkness in the world cannot extinguish the light of a single candle." -- St. Francis Of Assisi

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Elizabeth Gaskell
item.description: "Wearily she went to bed, wearily she arose in four or five hours' time. But with the morning came hope, and a brighter view of things." -- Elizabeth Gaskell

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Dieter F. Uchtdorf
item.description: "Though we are incomplete, God loves us completely. Though we are imperfect, He loves us perfectly. Though we may feel lost and without compass, God's love encompasses us completely. ... He loves every one of us, even those who are flawed, rejected, awkward, sorrowful, or broken." -- Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "Your friends will know you better in the first minute you meet than your acquaintances will know you in a thousand years." -- Richard Bach

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Jennifer Donnelly
item.description: "I know it is a bad thing to break a promise, but I think now that it is a worse thing to let a promise break you." -- Jennifer Donnelly

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "She said, "Do you have more things that you need, or more that you don't need?" I said, "It depends on what it means to need." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Gemma Malley
item.description:
"I love you, Anna Covey,' he said, his voice barely audible. And slowly, clumsily, he leant forward, and his lips found hers, and as Anna felt him kiss her awkwardly, she knew that she wasn't a Surplus anymore. And nor was Peter.
Surplus meant unnecessary. Not required.
You couldn't be a Surplus if you were needed by someone else. You couldn't be a Surplus if you were loved." -- Gemma Malley

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I can live alone, if self-respect, and circumstances require me so to do. I need not sell my soul to buy bliss. I have an inward treasure born with me, which can keep me alive if all extraneous delights should be withheld, or offered only at a price I cannot afford to give." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Books are my friends, my companions. They make me laugh and cry and find meaning in life." -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Natalie Babbitt
item.description: "Don't be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don't have to live forever, you just have to live." -- Natalie Babbitt

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence." -- Aristotle

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Anne Bronte
item.description: "But he who dares not grasp the thorn Should never crave the rose." -- Anne Bronte

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I am [in your world].’ said Aslan. ‘But there I have another name. You must learn to know me by that name. This was the very reason why you were brought to Narnia, that by knowing me here for a little, you may know me better there." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Lisa Mangum
item.description: "The world is full of impossibilities - some beautiful, some terrible - but sometimes, when you least expect it, they can become possible." -- Lisa Mangum

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Mary Wollstonecraft
item.description: "The beginning is always today." -- Mary Wollstonecraft

item.title: alisonwonderland add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche
